name: 0c3a314f-9724-5cb3-8f47-388709dd3c31
notes: This text seeks to explore Book IV of Horace's Odes not as isolated works of adulatory verse, but as a collection of subliminal vignettes on Roman society in the early days of the Principate. That they were written as individual items over a period of time, ranging from 13 BC. to 8 BC., is not disputed. That they were really intended by Horace as a complete entity in their own right is the primary argument of this work and is supported by a full translation, commentary and analysis of the Latin text in which the order of the odes has been reconstituted
title: Carmina. Liber 4. English & Latin
Verba ambigua Horati : the enigma of Book IV
